tekstueel_bewijs: Jesus stood still, and commanded him to be called
helper.rol_van_god: God/Jesus is primarily the Helper/Enabler of the man's request, though he is also the source of the Object.

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon is a recruitment of the will. It focuses on the intensity of the hearer's desire and the necessity of their 'desperate cry' to trigger the divine response.

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from Blindness (S2) to the realization of Self-Deception (~S1), leading to the desperate Cry (~S2) to reach Vision (S1).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Resolution is found in the 'Lamb of God' who cleanses the spot that the sinner cannot remove.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: High. Blindness is linked to 'grisly death' and 'poisoned wells'.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: While the sermon uses the language of total depravity and Christ-alone (Grace), the actantial structure is anthropocentric: the human 'cry' is the engine that stops Jesus and initiates the miracle.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: If more of us knew how bad is our condition, we would cry more desperately.

indicatoren_moralisme.indicator: Human as Primary Subject of Action

indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: Not Moses... Nor Socrates... Not Buddha... Give me Jesus.
When I see myself, I look at something loathsome and imperfect.

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Bartimaeus is used as the model for how the hearer should behave (loud, insistent, ignoring the crowd).
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Focus on Jesus' persistence in going to Jerusalem despite the blindness of all around him, including the disciples.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Pressure to produce a sufficiently 'strident' and 'insistent' faith/cry.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Synergism: God's action is contingent upon the quality of the human 'cry'.

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The sermon is rhetorically powerful but structurally tense between 'Just as I am' (Passive) and 'Cry louder' (Active).
spanning_punten: The sinner is 'poor, wretched, blind' yet must possess the 'eloquence of an intense desire' to be heard.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: To Thee, whose blood can cleanse each spot.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: The Spirit provides 'clarity of view' so the Subject can see the danger.

hamartologie.ernst_diagnose: Critical; sin is 'crawling evils' and 'poisoned wells'.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully humbles the hearer but then places the burden of 'performance' on the hearer's ability to cry out loud enough to stop Jesus.

subject_herpositionering.huidige_probleem: The hearer is the Subject seeking the Object (Vision).
subject_herpositionering.voorgestelde_herpositionering: Make Jesus the Subject who is seeking the lost blind man.
subject_herpositionering.voorbeeld_revisie: Instead of 'Bartimaeus cried until Jesus stopped,' use 'Jesus was on his way to the cross specifically to find the one the world tried to silence.'

identificatie_herstel.strategie: Emphasize that Jesus 'commanded him to be called'—the initiative of the call is divine.

modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: Focus more on Jesus' 'standing still' as an act of sovereign grace rather than a response to volume.

tegenstander_intensivering.theologische_rationale: The sermon already treats sin and Satan with appropriate gravity.

narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.probleem: The 'cry' (Ethics/Response) precedes the 'mercy' (Soteriology) in a way that suggests causality.
narratieve_hierarchie_herstel.voorgestelde_structuur: Proclaim the Mercy that enables the Cry.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A powerful, Christ-centered sermon that occasionally trips into 'moralism of the heart' by over-emphasizing the sinner's desperation as a prerequisite for grace.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: Rhetorically, the 'cry' is a powerful trope; semiotically, it functions as a human work that triggers divine action.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis notes Bartimaeus's faith; semiotics reveals that this faith is being framed as a 'modal competence' the hearer must manufacture.
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas reveals that despite the 'Just as I am' lyrics, the narrative engine is 'If you cry, He will stop.'

appendices.notities: The sermon is a classic example of 'High-Church Depravity' mixed with 'Low-Church Revivalism' (the necessity of the felt-need).
